news.headline: Exclusive tour for global media ahead of WorldSkills Lyon 2024
news.author: WorldSkills Media Team
news.content: More than 1,000 journalists from international media outlets are being invited to preview Eurexpo Lyon and get an insider look before the 47th WorldSkills Competition begins.

news.headline: Making Our Mark: Daniel
news.author: WorldSkills Media Team
news.content: Our Champions campaign shows the many ways young people are building a better world. Austrian welder Daniel Schinagl is using his skills to raise standards and help the global welding community connect and collaborate.

news.headline: Team Jamaica gears up for WorldSkills Lyon 2024
news.author: WorldSkills Media Team
news.content: One of the 69 countries and regions preparing for WorldSkills Lyon 2024, WorldSkills Jamaica is in high spirits. The team is learning from its experience in WorldSkills Competition 2022 Special Edition to help its young Competitors prepare.

news.headline: WorldSkills Champions Trust representative Dan McCabe shows Champions how they can use their voice
news.author: WorldSkills Media Team
news.content: With applications now open for the next WorldSkills Champions Trust cohort, Dan McCabe, WorldSkills Champions Trust representative for Europe, encourages Champions to think about how they would use their voice to highlight issues they are passionate about.

news.headline: Closing the skills gap needs conversation and cooperation: An interview with Chris Humphries
news.author: WorldSkills Media Team
news.content: WorldSkills Conference 2024 promises to host the largest global gathering on skills this year. Chris Humphries, President of WorldSkills, explains why it is an unmissable opportunity for the skills community to transform industries and drive economic prosperity.

news.headline: WorldSkills Champions Trust representative Yousra Assali invites Competitors to join her in making their mark
news.author: WorldSkills Media Team
news.content: With recruitment underway for the next WorldSkills Champions Trust, Yousra Assali, representative for the Middle East and North Africa, shares how she has used her voice to change perceptions of skilled youth in her region.

news.headline: Making Our Mark: Steven Harris
news.author: WorldSkills Media Team
news.content: Our campaign Making Our Mark tells the stories of WorldSkills Champions who are inspiring the next generation. Steven Harris from India uses his role as Expert in Graphic Design Technology to help international students set out their own path to success, while raising the profile of skills in his own country.

news.headline: Top five teams announced for the final of BeChangeMaker 2024
news.author: WorldSkills Media Team
news.content: The final five entrepreneurial businesses have been selected and are now preparing to deliver a live pitch on 12 September at WorldSkills Conference 2024 in Lyon, France.

news.headline: Make your mark with us. The search begins for the next WorldSkills Champions Trust representatives
news.author: WorldSkills Media Team
news.content: As applications open, WorldSkills Champions from across the skills community are invited to “make their mark” and become an ambassador for skills excellence.

news.headline: A perfect partnership: How one Competitor and Expert are preparing for WorldSkills Lyon 2024
news.author: WorldSkills Media Team
news.content: Across the globe, WorldSkills Competitors and Experts are putting the finishing touches to their Competition preparations. For WorldSkills Sweden’s Wall and Floor Tiling Competitor and Expert duo, Frida Malm and Andreas Markstedt, this means not leaving anything to chance.
